comments.creator: thebeastoburden@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.6) Gecko/20060728 Firefox/1.5.0.6
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.6) Gecko/20060728 Firefox/1.5.0.6

Whenever I attemtp to print anything with Firefox I cannot get my printer to work. It works for all my other applications and for Internet Explorer. I was trying to print shipping lablels from Paypal when the problem began yesterday. I have since uninstalled my printer and reinstalled it and all associated software but the problem persists. I have tested the printer twice and it is functional. After running several test prints I have found Firefox to be the problem. I an unassociated note I also have a problem with stereaming video and playing from a media player like Creative or Windows Media Player 11. I cannot acess any printer controls and the two problems seem interconnected. When I attempt to print I get the "Save file to folder" screen and it is followed by the message "printer failed to print". I also get the message "file could not be sent to printer." This problemn continues after uninsrtalling Firefox and reinstalling it. I suspect an upgrade to this program may be at fault but because this problem appeared in the middle of a print job yesterday my suspicions are dubious. Everything else works fine and it is Firefox that is the problem. The question is how do I fix this?

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Firefox
2. Go to any website or open any of my accounts with Paypal, etc.
3. Try printing anything from Firefox.

Actual Results:  
After selecting item or ordering the computer to print from a web page I get instructed to "Save file to..." from a save file popup window followed by the message "printer failed to print" when I close the window.

Expected Results:  
No printout. A TON of frustration!!!

The computer should have printed what it was expected to. It never asked me to save anything before. Now I am forced to use Internet Explorer (OH GOD! THAT SUCKS TOO! I HATE IE!}
comments.author: thebeastoburden@yahoo.com

This bug was reported on Firefox 2.x or older, which is no longer supported and will not be receiving any more updates. I strongly suggest that you update to Firefox 3.6.3 or later, update your plugins (flash, adobe, etc.), and retest in a new profile. If you still see the issue with the updated Firefox, please post here. Otherwise, please close as RESOLVED > WORKSFORME
http://www.mozilla.com
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Safe+mode
comments.author: tdowner@mozilla.com

comments.text: No reply, INCOMPLETE. Please retest with Firefox 3.6.x or later and a new profile (http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles). If you continue to see this issue with the newest firefox and a new profile, then please comment on this bug.
